name: Aloo Gobi
history: Aloo Gobi is a popular vegetarian dish in Indian cuisine. It's a simple yet flavorful dish that combines potatoes (aloo) and cauliflower (gobi) with a variety of spices.
description: Aloo Gobi is a dry curry dish made with potatoes, cauliflower, and Indian spices. This dish is known for its aromatic and mildly spiced flavor, making it a favorite in Indian households.

instructions.title: Saut Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and onions, sautÃ© until onions turn golden. Stir in ginger-garlic paste.

instructions.title: Add Potatoes and Cauliflower
instructions.description: Add potatoes, cauliflower, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Stir well to coat the vegetables in the spices.

instructions.title: Cook the Vegetables
instructions.description: Add a little water, cover the pan, and cook on a low heat until the vegetables are tender.

instructions.title: Add Tomatoes and Garam Masala
instructions.description: Add chopped tomatoes and garam masala. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the vegetables are completely cooked.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

tips: Stir occasionally while cooking to prevent sticking and ensure even cooking.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to suit your spice preference.
variations: Add peas or carrots for additional flavor and nutrition.
Substitute cauliflower with broccoli for a different twist.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Garnish with a lemon wedge for added zest.
